review_title: Technology Development - worthwhile if you choose carefully
pros:
Well resourced, mature organisation that invests in its staff development, training, infrastructure. Particularly strong on leadership development and graduate programmes, and has been improving on technical leadership with an ongoing multi-year culture change programme ("Engineering Excellence").

Good mobility opportunities due to the size, scale and franchise - for example career pathways from tech into trading are possible.

Plenty of interesting technology projects to get involved in, if you know what to look for - good combination of technical challenge and business problem solving. If you're interested in the business domain, this will give you an advantage in one of the many business-facing roles, for example front office trading technology.

Has many high calibre employees, focused on delivery and execution excellence rather than politics and self promotion. In the right areas there's a culture of 'common good', helping each other and enhancing the outcomes for all (for example, a genuine desire and drive to improve engineering standards and tooling, led by empowered engineers).

Good pay and benefits, including non-financial aspects such as career growth opportunities. Strong focus on diversity and inclusion.
cons:
Size of the organisation can make it unwieldy; some technology projects overlap or duplicate effort needlessly, due to divisional management boundaries and challenges of working across teams, regions and sub-units.

Bureaucratic of course, given it's scale, but needs to pay a lot more attention to productivity metrics to make it's bureaucracy lean and efficient. Major recent focus on risk and controls has probably made this worse.
